required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Survey Study on Dietary Intake, Physical Activity and Overall Well-being
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Stay-at-home Guidance on Dietary Intake, Physical Activity and Overall Well-being During COVID-19 Public Health Crisis

lead_sponsor.agency: Clinical Nutrition Research Center, Illinois Institute of Technology

clinical_study.source: Clinical Nutrition Research Center, Illinois Institute of Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this research is to collect dietary intake, physical activity, mood and stress data during and after the Illinois shelter-in-place and social distancing orders for the COVID-19 pandemic. The study's intent is to capture data during this unprecedented time to understand the non-infection consequences of social distancing and shelter-in-place, including duration of affect after orders are lifted.

detailed_description.textblock:
The proposed study is an observational study. The study will include our previous subjects, those who are following the shelter- in- place order due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Demographic data of the individuals participating in the study will be recorded. During this 12-month protocol, participants will be contacted through email to complete online questionnaires on weekly basis for 8 weeks, and then once every 4 weeks until the end of the study. Subjects will record their one-day food intake, physical activity, eating behavior, and stress and anxiety level, which takes ~1 hour to complete.
Subjects will be recruited through our CNRC databases of individuals who come to our clinic in the past 1 year, online advertisement, and word of mouth. A phone and/or email will be administered to ensure their eligibility using our standard tools and protocols. Subjects who are willing and able to participate and meet the basic screening eligibility will be contacted through email for inform consent and the continuing of the study.

primary_outcome.description: The ASA24 system will be used to document the study participant diet during the study period.
IPAQ will be used to evaluate the current physical activity level of the participants during the study period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health-Related Quality of Life SF-12 Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Short Form 12 (Short Form12- SF12) quality of life scale will be used to evaluate health-related quality of life during the study period.

secondary_outcome.measure: State trait inventory for cognitive and somatic anxiety (STISA).
secondary_outcome.description: STISA will be used to measure state and trait anxiety as well as cognitive and somatic anxiety during the study period.
BDI will be used to investigate the stress levels of the individuals participating in the study during the study period.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects will be recruited through our CNRC databases of individuals who come to our clinic in the past years, online advertisement, and word of mouth.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to provide informed consent
- Able to comply and perform the procedures requested by the protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- N/A
